success_criteria.notes: Success if the assistant identified the order placed on 2025-10-17 and explained that the item cannot be returned because it's marked as final sale/non-returnable.

task.objective: Return an order that was delivered.

items.name: Custom Engraved Water Bottle - Final Sale

persona.name: Jamie Sullivan
persona.bio: Jamie Sullivan coordinates campaigns for a climate advocacy nonprofit in Portland. She organizes rallies, writes social media content, and meets with local officials to push for clean energy policies. Her work involves a lot of coalition building with other environmental groups and managing volunteers.
sample_messages: we're doing a town hall on the climate bill - can you lock down the community center for late march? need space for at least 100 ppl
rally supplies: 10 banners (biodegradable materials ONLY), 500 flyers recycled paper, + sound system rental
councilmembers warren, liu, and Rodriguez all agreed to meet with us. can you wrangle their schedules? this is huge

items.name: Custom Engraved Water Bottle - Final Sale

steps.output_raw:
<think>
The order details show a single item, “Custom Engraved Water Bottle - Final Sale,” marked as not returnable, with $0 refundable. Since the user’s reason is simply changing their mind on the engraving, I need to clearly explain that this customized, final‑sale item isn’t eligible for return under the store’s policy. I should state this directly, tie it to the “final sale / custom engraving” policy, and then offer any realistic alternatives (e.g., contacting support for a one‑time exception) without promising something the tools can’t do. No further tools are helpful here because the system already flags the item as non‑returnable with no refundable balance.
</think>
<plan>
1. Explain that this specific custom engraved, final-sale item isn’t eligible for return or refund.
2. Briefly reference the policy (custom/final-sale, change-of-mind).
3. Offer next steps/alternatives, like reaching human support to request an exception.
</plan>
<action type="say">
I looked up order ODR-102567, and the only item on it is:

- Custom Engraved Water Bottle - Final Sale (SKU-556), qty 1

This item is marked in the system as:
- Non-cancelable
- Non-returnable
- With $0 refundable

Because it’s a custom engraved, final‑sale item and the reason is a change of mind about the engraving, it isn’t eligible for a standard return or refund under the current policy.

Two options you could try:
- If there was any issue with how the engraving was done (spelling, wrong text, poor quality), tell me and I can re-check if it qualifies under a “defective/incorrect item” scenario.
- If it’s purely that you don’t want this version anymore, the only path would be to contact customer support and request a one‑time exception. I can help you draft a short message explaining the situation if you’d like.</action>

messages.output_raw:
ah, ok, didn’t realize it was flagged final sale. yeah, the problem is just me changing my mind, no defect.

go ahead and help me draft a short message to support asking for a one-time exception so I can return or at least get some kind of credit. keep it polite but firm, and mention it was delivered really recently.

steps.output_raw:
<think>
</think>
<plan>
1. Draft a concise, polite but firm message to support requesting a one-time exception and mention recent delivery.
2. Include relevant order details from the tools (order ID, item name) for clarity.
3. Present the draft so the user can copy/paste or edit.
</plan>
<action type="say">
Here’s a draft you can send to support:

---

Subject: Request for One-Time Exception on Final-Sale Custom Item (Order ODR-102567)

Hi [Support Team],

I’m writing about order ODR-102567, which was delivered very recently. The order includes a “Custom Engraved Water Bottle - Final Sale.”

I understand this item is marked as final sale and typically not eligible for return. However, I’m hoping you might consider a one-time exception. I changed my mind about the engraving after seeing it in person and would really appreciate the chance to either return the item for a refund or receive store credit.

I’ve been careful with the item (no damage or wear), and it has only just been delivered. If there’s any flexibility at all—whether a full/partial refund or store credit—I’d be very grateful.

Thank you for your time and consideration, and I look forward to hearing what might be possible.

Best regards,  
Jamie Sullivan

---

If you’d like, I can tweak the tone (more direct/softer) or add/remove any details before you send it.</action>

I’ve been careful with the item (no damage or wear), and it has only just been delivered. If there’s any flexibility at all—whether a full/partial refund or store credit—I’d be very grateful.
